sentences.sContent: I prefer the first one because this kind of learning is systematic and formal.
sentences.sContent_eng: I prefer the first one because this kind of learning is systematic and formal.
sentences.sCn: 我更喜欢第一个，因为这种学习是系统的和正式的。

sentences.sContent: There is no substitute for confronting a case, building your own systematic way to analyze it, then improving your model through discussions with others.
sentences.sContent_eng: There is no substitute for confronting a case, building your own systematic way to analyze it, then improving your model through discussions with others.
sentences.sCn: 面对案例，建立你自己的系统的方式分析它、然后通过与别人讨论改善你的模型，这一过程无法代替。

sentences.sContent: The systematic name encodes the structure and composition of the caffeine molecule in some detail, and provides an unambiguous reference to this compound, whereas the name "caffeine" just names it.
sentences.sContent_eng: The systematic name encodes the structure and composition of the caffeine molecule in some detail, and provides an unambiguous reference to this compound, whereas the name "caffeine" just names it.
sentences.sCn: 系统名称在一些细节上包含了咖啡因分子结构和组成，并提供了一个明确的参照，而这种化合物名为“咖啡因”只是它的名字。

synos.tran: 系统的；体系的；有系统的；[图情]分类的

phrases.pCn: 系统性风险；不可避免的风险
系统脱敏疗法；系統減敏法

words.tran: 组织化；系统化；制度化；组织主义
分类者；组织者；使体系化的人
系统化，体系化（systematize的过去式）
使系统化；使组织化；将…分类
使系统化；使有秩序（等于systematize）
